intro: Pectis uniaristata var. jangadensis, commonly known as the Jangadensis pectis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
